column2: ####### At this point (19/03/21) some behaviours are still very rare (fewer than 5 times), so I combine them with less rare behaviours that are very similar in movement patterns (e.g., Flail-contact is integrated in Hit) or several of them are combined into one (e.g., most of the object-directed behaviours become one called 'Explore_object'). Once more data become available for some of these, this decision should be reconsidered case-by-case
elements.bout <- change.elements(elements.to.change = c("Retreat-backwards", "Flee"), new = "Retreat", elem.bout = elements.bout)
elements.bout <- remove.serial(elem.bout = elements.bout, elem.time = elements.time, to.remove = 'Bipedal', move.first = TRUE)
elements.bout <- remove.serial(elem.bout = elements.bout$elements, elem.time = elements.bout$time, to.remove = 'Hold', move.first = TRUE)
elements.bout <- remove.serial(elem.bout = elements.bout$elements, elem.time = elements.bout$time, to.remove = 'Retreat', move.first = TRUE)
elements.bout <- remove.serial(elem.bout = elements.bout$elements, elem.time = elements.bout$time, to.remove = 'Follow-Other', move.first = TRUE)
elements.bout <- remove.serial(elem.bout = elements.bout$elements, elem.time = elements.bout$time, to.remove = 'Approach', move.first = TRUE)
elements.bout <- remove.serial(elem.bout = elements.bout$elements, elem.time = elements.bout$time, to.remove = 'Branch-pull', move.first = TRUE)
elements <- intersect(elements, unlist(strsplit(unlist(elements.bout), split = "%", fixed = T)))
